p:
One of the most important epidemiological parameters when monitoring an epidemic is R 0 (ie, the number of secondary cases induced by a single infected individual in a totally susceptible population) because it is fundamental to assess the potential spread of a microorganism. Its value changes during an epidemic being called the effective reproduction number ( R e). R 0 is usually estimated on the basis of the growth rate of the number of cases. The available epidemiological estimates of SARS‐CoV‐2 R 0 range from 2.2 to 2.9, although they changed from 1.4 to more than 7 during the first phases of the epidemic.
